sections.title: Cover Sheet

questions.sample_answer: October 26, 2023

Community Garden Initiative

questions.sample_answer: January 1, 2024 - December 31, 2024

sections.title: Narrative Section
sections.description: Detailed description of the organization, project, and evaluation plan.

questions.sample_answer: Community Support Initiative, Inc. was founded in 2010 with a mission to address food insecurity and promote community health in Anytown.  We began with a small food pantry and have since expanded to offer nutrition education programs and community events.  Our consistent growth demonstrates our commitment to serving the needs of our community.

questions.text: State your mission and goals, future challenges, and long-range plans.
questions.sample_answer: Our mission is to cultivate a thriving community by improving access to nutritious food and fostering community engagement. Our goals include increasing the number of community gardens, expanding our nutrition education programs, and creating a sustainable community food system.  Challenges include securing adequate funding and recruiting volunteers. Our long-range plan is to establish a community-owned farm to support our efforts.

Currently, we operate a food pantry, offer weekly nutrition education workshops, host community events, and manage a small community garden.  We also collaborate with local schools and health organizations to maximize our impact. We are committed to building strong partnerships to meet the needs of our community.

Over the past year, we distributed over 10,000 pounds of food through our food pantry, served 150 individuals in our nutrition education workshops, and engaged over 200 community members in our events. Our small community garden produced over 500 pounds of fresh produce, which was distributed to families in need.  This demonstrates our commitment to providing impactful services.

questions.text: Describe the proposed program or project.
questions.sample_answer: The Community Garden Initiative will establish a larger, more productive community garden. This will include constructing raised garden beds, installing an irrigation system, and providing educational workshops on gardening techniques. This garden will increase local food production, provide opportunities for community engagement, and improve access to fresh produce for low-income families.

questions.text: Identify the needs/problems to be addressed, target population and number of people to be served by the project.
questions.sample_answer: The need is to increase access to fresh, affordable produce for low-income families in Anytown.  Our target population is families with children who rely on food assistance programs. We anticipate serving at least 100 families through this initiative.

questions.text: Describe the project goals and objectives, and your plan to meet them.
questions.sample_answer: Our goal is to cultivate a productive community garden that provides fresh produce to families in need.  Our objectives include constructing 20 raised garden beds, holding at least 12 educational workshops, and recruiting 20 volunteers.  We will achieve this through community outreach, volunteer recruitment, and partnerships with local organizations.

questions.text: Define the project as a new or continuing program.
questions.sample_answer: New Program

questions.text: Identify other organizations, partners or funders participating in the project and their roles.
questions.sample_answer: We are collaborating with the Anytown Parks and Recreation Department, which is providing the land for the garden.  The local Master Gardeners Association will provide expertise and support for educational workshops.  We have also received a small grant from the local Rotary Club.

Phase 1 (January-March): Secure land, recruit volunteers, and purchase supplies. Phase 2 (April-June): Construct raised beds and install irrigation. Phase 3 (July-December): Plant crops, conduct workshops, and harvest produce.

We plan to seek additional grants from foundations and corporations, as well as explore opportunities for fundraising through community events.  We will also aim to generate income through the sale of excess produce.

questions.text: If a similar program or service has been conducted by your organization or another, please discuss its impact. Does it represent an expansion or duplication of services in your area? If it doesn’t, define its potential to serve as a model program locally or nationally.
questions.sample_answer: This program represents an expansion of our existing community garden.  The success of our smaller garden demonstrates the community's interest and need for increased access to fresh produce. This larger garden has the potential to serve as a model program for other communities facing similar challenges, demonstrating how community gardens can increase access to healthy foods and foster community engagement.

questions.text: Describe your plan to document progress and results.
questions.sample_answer: We will track the number of volunteers recruited, the amount of produce harvested, and the number of families served. We will conduct monthly progress reports to the grant provider and a final report outlining our achievements and challenges at the project's conclusion.  Our success will be measured by increased produce output, volunteer participation, and community engagement.

sections.title: Attachments
sections.description: List of required documents to be submitted with the grant application.

questions.text: Copy of the current IRS determination letter indicating 501(c)(3) tax-exempt status.
questions.sample_answer: Attached
Attached

questions.text: Organizational structure, including: List of officers and directors, including occupations, places of employment, and relevant affiliations; Description of board responsibilities, including committee assignments; Resumes and/or job descriptions of key personnel involved in the project.
questions.sample_answer: Attached

questions.text: Finances, including: Grant budget; List of other funders, potential funders and amounts committed or requested, including public contracts, individual contributions and other sources of income supporting the project; Current board-approved annual operating budget, including expenses and income; Most recent audited annual financial statement; Letters of support (optional) that substantiate need for the project and collaboration with other organizations; Annual report, if available.
questions.sample_answer: Attached

sections.title: Budget
sections.description: Detailed budget breakdown for the proposed project.

questions.text: Please specify the budget period (e.g., January 1, 2024 to December 31, 2024).
questions.sample_answer: January 1, 2024 - December 31, 2024

questions.text: Please itemize the following expenses. Be sure to include any additional items relevant to your particular program. Provide an expense total.
questions.sample_answer: This section would contain a detailed breakdown of expenses, including salaries, payroll taxes, fringe benefits, consultant fees, travel, equipment, supplies, printing, telephone, postage, rent, utilities, and in-kind expenses, culminating in a total expenses figure.

questions.text: Please include all confirmed and anticipated sources of revenue, and indicate their status. Provide an income total.
questions.sample_answer: This section details all confirmed and anticipated income sources, such as government grants, foundation grants, corporate donations, earned income, United Way funding, individual contributions, fundraising events, membership income, and in-kind support, leading to a total income figure.
